name: B.S., Family and Consumer Sciences: Apparel Design and Merchandising

Pattern C: Textiles and Apparel (25 units)
and CHEM 100L Principles of Chemistry Lab (1)
and CHEM 110L Chemistry in Action Lab (1)
FCS 150/L Apparel Construction I and Lab (2/1)
Select 18 units of upper division Family and Consumer Sciences textiles and apparel courses, with approval of an advisor.
Undergraduate students must complete 48 units of General Education as described in this Catalog, including 3 units of coursework meeting the Ethnic Studies (ES) graduation requirement.
3 units are satisfied by the following course in the major: FCS 357 satisfies 3 units of upper division D1 Social Sciences.
9 units are satisfied by the following courses in the major: ECON 160 and FCS 357 satisfy D1 Social Sciences; and BUS 104 satisfies E Lifelong Learning.
If taken, FCS 324 satisfies B5 Scientific Inquiry and Quantitative Reasoning and fulfills the Information Competence requirement.

6 units are satisfied by the following courses in the major: CHEM 100 or CHEM 110 satisfies B1 Physical Science; CHEM 100L or CHEM 110L satisfies B3 Science Laboratory Activity; and FCS 357 satisfies 3 units of upper division D1 Social Sciences.
Total Units for the B.S. Degree: 120
